reviewText: This video shows how amazing and brilliant Larry Bird was to the game of basketball. It highlights how he had the uncanny ability to be 3 steps ahead of the other ball players and outsmart them to win games.  Great presentation and game highlights show how he is arguably the greatest all around basketball player ever to play.
Title: Larry Bird: A Basketball Legend

reviewText: The documentary itself is outstanding. One of the best sports documentaries I have seen. It is narrated by Daniel Stern and has some great unseen footage, at least by me, of Bird at ISU and his early days with the Celtics. No complaints. Awesome.The games they included?Come on!If you are going to include a Portland game, include the 1985 game with the greatest buzzer beater ever. That game was awesome. It was epic. It was huge.I agree with his 60 point game. He was hitting all kinds of shots. It was great.I agree with the last quarter of the shootout with Wilkins.But no games against the Lakers or Sixers, which were his most epic and memorable? That's where they went off the rail with this set.
Title: Larry Bird: A Basketball Legend

reviewText: Really well done...The Hick from French Lick....to me, one of the five greatest players of all time. And since I graduated from Indiana University, I was chagrined he signed, left, and then went to Indiana State Teachers College. I was never much of an NBA fan, yet when Larry and Magic rebuilt the NBA, I watched the Celtics until Bird retired.  He is just so great, it's hard to explain. And this video brings back his superb work ethic, and uncanny talents. Really happy I bought this DVD. Kent Oram
Title: Larry Bird: A Basketball Legend

reviewText: My husband grew up in French Lick at the same time Larry Bird did.  He is always interested in all things Larry Bird, not just because they are from the same town, but because Larry Bird is the type if person that other people look up to.  He has amazing skills and honesty and integrity.  This dvd is a favorite of my husband, not only for the portrayal of Larry Bird, but also the footage of French Lick back in the day.
Title: Larry Bird: A Basketball Legend

reviewText: I'm sick and tired of many fans who dare to compare larry with great legends like JABAR, MAGIC JOHNSON, JORDAN...ETCYes....back then larry was possibly the best WHITE player in the courts but as we all know basketball always dominated by BLACK players most of times.The real legends therefore were JABAR, JORDAN and MAGIC JOHNSON and not larry bird.My complaint is that because larry was white he was elevated in to such heights because he was also a very good player so those "specialists" of the time dared to compare him with the real dominant players like those i mentioned above.Sometimes THE TRUTH MUST BE TOLD.
summary: Possibly the greatest WHITE basketball player but he is OVERRATED....
Title: Larry Bird: A Basketball Legend

reviewText: Good video. Tells a good story about Larry. Mentions his childhood, Indiana State. Has childhood friends, high school and collegeteammates and coaches. Plays good song about his days at Indiana State. Shows highlights of Celtic career interspersed with comments from teammates and opponents. Must for Larry Bird fans.
Title: Larry Bird: A Basketball Legend
